reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Wellington based on price and location. We did not have high expectations going in and were not disappointed. The room was rather run down looking, but clean. There was an outlet cover missing as well as a light fixture cover which gave it a not so cared for feeling. Our window looked right into an office full of cubicles with people working.
reviews.title: Clean but kind of run down.

likes.disliked: — the rooms were not very nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location wise, the hotel is within walking distance of Times Square and Central Park.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was very crowded with groups of teenage kids. The lobby is very small, so you really had to make your way through crowds a lot of the time.
reviews.title: Much better than expected after seeing previous reviews.

reviews.text: In any other place, I would not pay the price they charge for this hotel, but it is New York!
reviews.title: For theatre lovers

reviews.text: Just returned from a 4 day break in NY.Could not falter the location, was very close to Times Square & Theatre district & all the shopping! We had a room on the 16th floor, was quiet,clean and pleasant. You get what you pay for, we got a bargain on the net,so thats why we choose this hotel.Staff are helpful & courteous. Ideal for a short stay if you're looking for somewhere just to put your head down for the night. When in NY you dont actually spend much time in the room anyway. Would certainly recommend this hotel to others. Some great places nearby where you can dine.
reviews.title: Great Location, Nice Place

reviews.text: We went for an early supper last night. The waiter got my drinks order wrong, then when I asked him to change it he started arguing with me! He was very sharp with the other diners too. When my husband's order arrived it was the wrong order, also the burger was cremated and totally inedible. I had salmon, which was th only good thing about the experience, that was cooked perfectly, however the carrots had obviously been in the bain marie all day and were brown and soggy, the peas (frozen) were cold and the mash too salty. We didn't expect gourmet food but at least a decent meal would have sufficied. Will never go back there again
reviews.title: Awful experience
Great place to go and eat
reviews.text: Have been to this restaurant a couple of times now, all I can say is that they are great. The food is great value and good quality. They offer 2 for £9.99 on some meals which is great value. I would recommend it to anyone.

Arrived at 2pm on a Sunday afternoon, seated quickly and the waitress Maria dealt with our order promptly. However, the food took a while to arrive and the length of time between courses was too long. If it wasn't for the excellent attitude of Maria, we would have left. The food quality was excellent, it just needed to be dealt with in the kitchen quicker. Very reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Great food and service, good price but the kitchen needs to be more efficient

reviews.text: Went along to the new Wellington Hotel on Wellington Road for breakfast. It was great value, freshly cooked and the staff were spot on
reviews.title: Breakfast

reviews.text: Had an excellent meal at the opening night of the new Wellington Hotel (formerly the Gordon Hotel). Belhaven have done a superb job of refurbishing the property and the food, while not sophisticated, was well cooked and tasty. Service was friendly and efficient too. The only disappointment was the kids play area which really appears to have been installed as an afterthought and is nothing more than a slightly partitioned tiny area in a corner with a TV stuck on the wall.
reviews.title: Excellent Opening Night.

reviews.text: We were on holiday from Australia and were very impressed by the value, service and food at the Wellington. We visited the restaurant 4 or 5 times for birthdays and get togethers. There was only a couple of minor problems - they ran out of orange juice on one visit, and the ham was a a bit stringy on one occasion. It's not cordon blue, but for family eating, it's good tasty food.
reviews.title: We just kept coming back

reviews.text: The staff were very helpful and I think they got to know us after the second visit. They even had a good sense of humour, which they needed with our motley bunch. (Simon - you're great!)
reviews.title: Great service, pitty about the food.

reviews.text: Went to the Wellington for supper tonight and I must say I was very disappointed.
reviews.title: What a dissapointing meal

reviews.text: I ordered the Roast beef which was ok except the potatoes and Yorkshire pudding had been well over cooked (all of the meals we ordered had this problem) My boyfriend had the roast chicken which was dry and not very hot and he left most of it and my sister had the roast gammon which she couldn't eat as is tasted quite bad - she compared it to hospital food. I am not one to complain but I feel something needs to be done to improve the food quality as my bill came to around £50 then we ended up going for a chipper an hour later which cost us another £15 as we were all still hungry.
reviews.title: amazing - super

reviews.text: Its a shame as the waitress (Susan) was clearly rushed off her feet as all the tables in her area were full and I heard her sincerely apologising to a few other customers about the quality of their food.
reviews.title: Must try harder, or this place won't last long

reviews.text: This newly refurbished hotel restaurant was a real treat. Excellent staff, service and food. Could not have asked for more. Customer service was first class. Definitely be back in the near future.
reviews.title: Excellent customer service

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Wellington overnight with our 2 year old daughter. Rooms were lovely with excellent shower. Restaurant has a pleasant atmosphere and our daughter loved playing with the toys. My steak was lovely and my husband recommends the haggis fritters!
reviews.title: Lovely Family Friendly Hotel
Breakfast
reviews.text: We went for breakfast last weekend. The place was empty. We ordered our breakfast then it came and we didn't get what we asked for. But was so hungry we just had it. The waiter wasn't really that friendly either. Don't think I will return for a while.

reviews.title: Friendly and efficient, good experience.
reviews.text: I was in tonight with my family and the service we recieved was very genuine and friendly, not robotic like most places that are available now. The meals were good value for money and there was plenty of variety to choose from.

reviews.title: Great food and great rooms
reviews.text: Was a huge change from the previous experience of this restaurant before the refurb, pleasant surroundings and a realxed family atmosphere. I would definatley return and recommend to family and friends.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Wellington for 4 nights and were please with our choice of accommodation. We were not sure what to expect as we were told you don't get much for your money in New York but it worked out quite well. This hotel is in a fabulous location, only a few blocks from Times Square and Broadway and within walking distance of 5th Ave. There are many great places to eat right near by and great nightlife too. the diner at the front od the hotel has great food and friendly people too. The room was not huge but it was clean and had air conditioning. In a city like New York you don't need to spend much time in your room anyway. The only problem we had was with the lifts. Sometimes we were waiting 10 minutes to get the lift. Other than that Hotel Wellington was great value for money with a fabulous location.
reviews.title: Good for New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Couldn't have asked for a better location on hotels as far as me and my husband are concerned, situated on 7th avenue and 55th street right next to carnige hall. step out of the main hotel lobby look directly left and you will see the famous times square.
reviews.title: great location everything you need

reviews.text: we had a standard room, which looked out on the side street but stil a good view of the main road with all the police cars, yellow taxi's and people passing by going through there busy day.
reviews.title: Perfect stay
Great hotel, great location
reviews.text: the hotel was clean warm amd friendly and when i save up enough money again this will be where i am staying.

I took my mom to NY city May 27-31,2007 as my gift to her for mother's day in my firt visit ever to NY. I wanted the trip to be perfect, and it all starts with a good hotel. I booked my stay and honestly I was a bit worried about some of he reviews I saw posted online afterwards. The Wellington's location is AMAZING; so close to everything. There is one subway stop right off one of the hotel exits, and another just a block away.
reviews.title: Dirty room, things "disappeared"
Never again
reviews.text: Food was less than average, some was uneadible! Value was good, expect to pay less for a lower grade of food.

Service was not acceptible. After i was seated for my meal i waited 20 minutes with no service before being told that the manageress had requested i moved tables before i was served. Apon moving i waited a further 10 minutes before being approached for my order. When i had finished my meal i requested that the food be put on my room bill, my request was denied (although i had already put two drinks on my room previously) when i asked why this could not be put on my room i was told that the manageress had not allowed it and i would have to speak to her myself. Apon aproaching the manageress i was greeted with a very hostile tone and told that she was 'the manager and she makes the rules' I then settled my bill and retired to my room. It is safe to say that i will not be returning to the wellington hotel anytime soon. Also the rooms and bathrooms are very small, and if u advertise free wifi it should be availabe in the hotel rooms aswell as the restraunt!
reviews.title: good value and clean
Good food and service
reviews.text: They've spent a lot of money turning a tip into a family restaurant. meals can be a bit hit or miss, even now after a few months of opening. but any problems are always rectified.

staff are friendly and efficient especially Simon and Theodora. good range of choices with a change of menu every few months, good range of wines personally some better beer would be nice the heavy especially is either belhaven ir belhaven extra cold (sorry i like my beer) we use it a lot as its walking distance from home and good value when you are too busy to cook (or cant be bothered). wi-fi and some daily newpapers would be appreciated by me and the business dudes who use the hotel.
reviews.title: Not impressed

reviews.text: Saturday 25june 6 people, very pleasant staff and good food. The big sharing starter was very god hot and fresh. Rotisserie chicken good too. A full half chicken as well. The fajitas and burgers liked by those who had them .
reviews.title: Disapointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the location of this hotel is convenient, that is the only thing it has going for it. Everything in the hotel is shabby (cracked paint, peeling wallpaper) and the bathrooms are way too small.
reviews.title: You can do better
Well worth the price
reviews.text: The night that we stayed at The Wellington was the evening we got engaged in NYC. You'd think that our love 'haze' wouldn't have let anything bother us, but, in reality...this hotel did put a damper on our celebration.

The bed was the worst part of our experience. It was so incredibly uncomfortable that we checked out at 2am because neither of us could sleep on it. The seats on our train out of Grand Central were more comfortable to sleep on than that bed.
reviews.title: Crap Hotel

reviews.text: Not sure about some of the posts on here. We (wife and two kids, ages 1 and 4) stayed Sunday Jul 8th, 2007. Here's the true scoop:

CHECK-IN: Was able to check in early (1:00pm); no wait at all. Front lobby was adequately clean and pleasant. Staff was very courteous and helpful. Bell boy had our bags up to room before we even unlocked door. Also provided us with a clean crib (pack-n-play) for the 1yr old.
reviews.title: Filthy filth on fifth floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this property during Memorial Day weekend, we booked through the hotel directly several months in advance and recieved a great rate. The hotel is in a great location, we were within walking distance of Times Square, Central Park, and the Theater District. We arrived at the hotel at 12:00 and unfortunatly check in wasnt until 3:00 so we had to sit around in the lobby for quite awhile before going up to our room. There was a coffee shop located on the first floor that served very good food so that killed a little bit of our waiting time. We recieved the key to our room at about 2:00 and when we got up to it the maid had just finished cleaning. The room was very nice. It was a good size room, very clean, and had a nice view. It wasn't the Four Seasons, but I wasn't paying for the Four Seasons, so I was extremely pleased with what I got for my money - a very nice room with a very nice view. The staff were all very helpful and friendly and I had absolutly no complaints about this hotel. The next time I go to New York City I will be booking a room at the Wellington once again.
reviews.title: Had a wonderful stay - this is a great hotel for the price

likes.liked: — Clean room, good view of the city, great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at this hotel to the lobby being nice but on check-in we were not given a city view that we requested & the room was dirty the top cover was full of stains & the shower was'nt working. we were moved & we did get a city view but the room was much the same with broken blind ! hotel is in great location just a shame they up date bedding & clean up the place .
reviews.title: great location but not a nice hotel !

reviews.text: My first Priceline experience netted me a bargain at the Wellington. The rooms were not luxurious (I had booked based on price, not on charm) but were pleasant and very, very clean, although the location in a maze of hallways on the 12th floor of their north tower was a little creepy for a woman traveling alone. (Again, bargain rate, so I couldn't complain about room location.) Once inside the suite (all I'd wanted was a room - and I got a suite!), I was quite comfortable and slept very well. The biggest disappointment was the lack of a coffeemaker in the kitchenette; fortunately, there's a Starbuck's across the street, an Au Bon Pain 1/2 a block east on 55th, and coffee shop on the first floor of the hotel. Check-in was reminiscent of a trip to Disney - a line of people standing inside a roped-off path, and I was startled that I was not given my room number, but was told to have a seat and wait for a bellhop to call my name. It lacked a certain ambiance...but the wait was short, the bellhop was friendly. All in all, a comfortable place to stay, a wonderful location.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable and in a perfect location

likes.disliked: — No coffeemaker in the room, no help hauling luggage up stairs at front of hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took my husband to NYC for four days as a grad school gift. We stayed in early May (great time to go, weather is perfect) and we stayed at the Wellington at the suggestion of a close friend who has stayed there many times before. It was a great suggestion!
reviews.title: Great Location, Very Affordable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a GREAT location! You are just six blocks from Rockefeller Plaza, three-four blocks from Times Square and the Theater district, and just three blocks from Central Park. The location could not have been better. There are two subway stations to access - one outside the hotel on the corner and one two blocks down - so which ever way you need to go, it's easy.
reviews.title: Not a bad hotel, great location
